name: Harvest
body:
# Harvest

Very early days!

# What is Harvest?

Harvest is a game that lets players see what it's like to run a business in the shared, limited resource of a fishing ground. Will players co-operate and fish sustainably, or go for short term profit and harvest the fish to extinction?

# Why make Harvest online?

Three reasons: fun, learningâ€¦ and profit.

**Fun**: Harvest is simple but entertaining to play.

**Learning**: I wanted to build an app with a small problem domain to experiment with [CQRS](http://www.martinfowler.com/bliki/CQRS.html) and [Event Sourcing](http://martinfowler.com/eaaDev/EventSourcing.html) in Ruby. I also wanted to try building a rich-client browser app (I'll use [Ember.js](http://emberjs.com/)) against a simple API server (using [Webmachine](https://github.com/seancribbs/webmachine-ruby)). This all makes it a big detour from The Rails Way, which means more work now, but will lead potentially to more powerful tools in future.

**Profit**: The engine for Harvest could be used to build many other games and simulations. It could conceivably even be used to build management dashboard simulations. But these ideas are a long way off. Profit is not an immediate goal: this is an experiment first, a startup second.

# Who

Harvest is being written by [Ash Moran](https://github.com/ashmoran) of [PatchSpace Ltd](http://www.patchspace.co.uk/). You can contact me at [ash.moran@patchspace.co.uk](mailto:ash.moran@patchspace.co.uk) - non-spam emails are welcome!
